SEARCH
Package com.example.moodmasters.MVC

Class MVCModel

java.lang.Object
com.example.moodmasters.MVC.MVCModel
public class MVCModel extends Object
Class that represents the Model part of the MVC framework, will be sent messages by the Controller to do certain requests like data manipulation and as a result do that data manipulation and update the Views that depend on that data manipulation once it has finished

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    MVCModel()
    Empty constructor for the Model, initializes all members to empty

  • Constructor Details

    • MVCModel

      public MVCModel()
      Empty constructor for the Model, initializes all members to empty

  • Method Details

    • createBackendObject

      public void createBackendObject(BackendObject.State backend_object)
      Creates a backend object in the Model, currently there are 5 backend objects all represented as elements of the enum BackendObject.State, some of these objects will only be created once and stay alive over the course of the app till termination, others will change dynamically depending on the users interaction with the app (ex. a USER backend object will be created on login and once the user logouts the USER object will be destroyed and once the user re-logins the USER object will be created again)
      Parameters:
      backend_object - Represents the backend object that should be created on a given call to this method

    • removeBackendObject

      public void removeBackendObject(BackendObject.State backend_object)
      Remove a pre-existing backend object from the Model, if the backend object does not exists throw an exception
      Parameters:
      backend_object - The backend object to remove from the Model

    • getBackendObject

      public MVCBackend getBackendObject(BackendObject.State backend_object)
      Return a pre-existing backend object to the caller of this method
      Parameters:
      backend_object - The backend object to return from the Model
      Returns:
      A backend object that will be returned depending on the argument

    • addView

      public void addView(MVCView new_view)
      Adds a View to the Model for storage, also calls it initialize method if there is some needed code to be executed immediately on addition to the Model
      Parameters:
      new_view - The new View that will be added to the Model

    • removeView

      public void removeView(MVCView delete_view)
      Removes a View from storage in the Model, if the View does not exist in the Model already we throw an exception
      Parameters:
      delete_view - The view that should be deleted from the Model

    • addDependency

      public void addDependency(MVCView new_view, BackendObject.State backend_object)
      Adds a dependency between a backend object and a pre-existing View that is stored in the Model, this is so the Model knows what Views to call update on during data manipulation of backend objects
      Parameters:
      new_view - The View that depends on the backend object, will now have it's update method now called on changes to the backend object
      backend_object - The backend object the View depends on

    • notifyViews

      public void notifyViews(BackendObject.State backend_object)
      Calls the update method on all the Views the Model knows of to notify them to update, this is only done for Views that depend on the backend object given as argument
      Parameters:
      backend_object - The backend object the View must depend on for it's update method to be called

    • addToBackendList

      public <T> void addToBackendList(BackendObject.State backend_object, T object)
      Adds a new object to a backend object only if that backend object is a List, if it isn't a exception is thrown
      Parameters:
      backend_object - The backend object the object will be added to
      object - The object to add to the backend object

    • removeFromBackendList

      public <T> void removeFromBackendList(BackendObject.State backend_object, T object)
      Removes a object from a backend object only if that backend object is a List, if it isn't a exception is thrown
      Parameters:
      backend_object - The backend object the object will be removed from
      object - The object to remove from the backend object

    • removeFromBackendList

      public void removeFromBackendList(BackendObject.State backend_object, int position)
      Removes a object from a backend object only if that backend object is a List, if it isn't a exception is thrown
      Parameters:
      backend_object - The backend object the object will be removed from
      position - Position in the backend object List to remove an object

    • getFromBackendList

      public <T> T getFromBackendList(BackendObject.State backend_object, int position)
      Gets a object from a backend object only if that backend object is a List, if it isn't a exception is thrown
      Parameters:
      backend_object - The backend object the object will be gotten from
      position - Position in the backend object List to get the object

    • replaceObjectBackendList

      public <T> void replaceObjectBackendList(BackendObject.State backend_object, int position, T new_object)
      Replace a object from a backend object only if that backend object is a List, if it isn't a exception is thrown
      Parameters:
      backend_object - The backend object the object will replace another object in
      position - Position of the replacee object in the backend object
      new_object - The replacer object for the object in the backend object

    • getBackendList

      public <T> ArrayList<T> getBackendList(BackendObject.State backend_object)
      Returns a backend object List, if the backend object is not a List then a exception will be thrown
      Parameters:
      backend_object - The backend object List that will be returned
